title: Deep filled red onion and goat's cheese tart
description: A creamy, cheesy tart that's perfect for sharing with friends over a lazy lunch
instructions: Roll the pastry and line a deep 18cm loose-bottomed tin. Freeze for an hour.
Place the oil in a large pan and fry the onion slices for 15 minutes until golden.
Turn up the heat, add the vinegar. Cook for 2 minutes. Remove from the heat and mix in soft cheese until melted. Season.

Remove pastry case from the freezer and prick the base. Line with greaseproof paper and baking beans; blind bake for 10 minutes. Remove paper and beans, then bake for a further 10 minutes until golden. Remove from the oven, and reduce the heat to 180˚C / 160˚C fan.
Lightly whisk together the cream, eggs, and extra yolks. Add the onions to the case, then pour over the cream mix. Arrange hard goat's cheese on top.
Bake for 20-25 minutes. Garnish with chives and serve warm or cold.
imageDesc: A deep dish shortcrust tart with slices of baked goat's cheese, sprinkled with fresh snipped chives.
